title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and reserve 1 cup of the pasta water.
While the spaghetti is cooking, whisk together the eggs, Parmesan cheese, and Pecorino Romano cheese in a large bowl.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook until crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with the olive oil. Toss to coat the pasta with the oil.

Remove the pan from the heat and immediately pour the egg mixture into the pan with the hot pasta. Toss the pasta with the egg mixture until the sauce thickens slightly, about 1 minute. If the sauce seems too thick, add a little bit of the reserved pasta water to thin it out.
Season with black pepper to taste.
Serve the Spaghetti Carbonara immediately, topped with the reserved bacon.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, combine the chicken pieces with 2 tablespoons of yogurt, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of garam masala. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat the oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute, or until fragrant.
Stir in the cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder (if using) and cook for 30 seconds more.
Add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, and heavy cream to the pan. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of garam masala and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the Chicken Tikka Masala over rice, garnished with chopped cilantro.

title: Pad Thai
summary: A stir-fried rice noodle dish with shrimp, chicken, eggs, peanuts, and a tangy sauce.
ingredients: 1/4 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced
instructions: Cook the rice noodles according to package directions.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add the egg and scramble until cooked, then push it to the side of the pan.
Add the shrimp and chicken to the skillet and cook until cooked through.
Add the peanuts, tamarind paste, fish sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and chicken broth to the skillet.
Toss to combine and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
Add the cooked rice noodles to the skillet and toss to coat.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional chopped peanuts.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Spiced ground beef, fresh toppings, all wrapped up in a warm corn tortilla. A classic Tex-Mex dish!
ingredients: Your favorite taco toppings (shredded cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, salsa, sour cream, etc.)
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain off any excess grease.
Stir in the taco seasoning and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.
Warm the tortillas according to package instructions.
Assemble your tacos by filling them with ground beef, your favorite toppings, and enjoy!
